page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our area incorporates Great Brickhill ,Stoke Hammond and Stockgrove Park. The land is mostly hilly but partly flat.Our square is quite important for transport because it contains the Grand Union Canal which was the main canal to London. Also the railway from London to Liverpool Birmingham, Manchester, North Wales and Glasgow. There is a road that goes from Milton Keynes to Aylesbury and Leighton Buzzard.Most of our area is taken up by farming for horses and rough grazing for other cattle. There is alao a Stud Farm.The Traditional Industries were mostly carried out at home such as Lace Making,Straw Plaiting and Cord Waining.Other occupations like the Baker and the Blacksmiths had their own shops to do their jobs and they employed people to work with them.
